intro: Diasperus parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent habit. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Diasperus parvifolius is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
